synopsis: Amends Fiscal Year 2023 annual appropriations act to prohibit use of appropriated moneys for, or to support, certain State litigation related to climate change and greenhouse gas emissions.
Establishes process to exempt municipality from certain fair share affordable housing obligations based on flood risk.

Requires DEP and owners of certain reservoirs to implement certain flood control measures; authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoirs levels in response to severe weather events.
Requires electric public utilities to implement flood mitigation plans for certain electric distribution substations; prohibits rate increase pending implementation of flood mitigation plans.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act of 2020"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Requires insurers that sell flood insurance to provide certain policyholders with certain information.

Authorizes municipal challenge to non-redevelopment housing projects ordered by COAH unless order is based on exclusionary zoning; excludes flood-prone land from affordable housing vacant land analysis; provides housing obligation cap.
Requires electric public utility to reimburse residential or commercial customer for cost of certain spoiled items resulting from service outage more than 48 hours after end of storm.
Requires DEP to evaluate cumulative impact of stormwater when reviewing applications associated with warehouse and other high-density development projects.

Establishes Climate Change Mitigation and Resilience Financing Program in NJ Infrastructure Bank; imposes per-kilowatt hour charge on electric energy consumption to finance climate change mitigation and resilience projects.
Establishes process for recovery of Superstorm Sandy aid overpayments and makes General Fund appropriation.
Continues tax exempt status of certain real property owned by disabled veterans during reconstruction of homes destroyed by flood, storm, or other act of God.
Directs DOT and NJT to study and report on transportation infrastructure needs in coastal counties.
Establishes "Resiliency and Environmental System Investment Charge Program."

Requires DEP to prioritize funding for certain projects for acquisition of lands for recreation and conservation purposes and certain environmental infrastructure projects that include, or allow for, flood mitigation projects.
Establishes Office of Resilience in DCF.
Requires hazard mitigation plans to include climate change-related threat assessments and hazard prevention and mitigation strategies.
Requires electric public utility to reimburse customers for cost of certain spoiled products resulting from service outage more than 72 hours after end of storm.
Requires DOT to prioritize green stormwater infrastructure in design, construction, reconstruction, and repair of public highways.
Authorizes issuance of Operation Desert Storm license plates.
Adds to property tax levy cap exclusions increases in flood insurance premiums.
Revises permitting thresholds for certain types of development requiring CAFRA permit from DEP.

Permits business entities and nonprofit organizations to adopt certain responsibilities related to stormwater management basins; provides corporation business tax credit for adoption of stormwater management basins in certain watersheds.

Reduces allowed diversion of funds from stormwater, water, and sewer purposes to municipal and county budgets; requires municipalities and counties to notify Division of Local Government Services of diversions.
Makes $100 million in federal funds available to DEP for grants to local governments for drinking water, wastewater, and stormwater infrastructure projects.
Requires home insurance companies to cover water damage caused by ground seepage, water or sewer pipe damage, or flooding.
Establishes Office of School Climate in DOE and directs School Climate State Coordinator to develop central repository of resources for parents on harassment, intimidation, and bullying in schools.
Revises requirements for school safety teams; requires creation of district school climate improvement plans.
Excludes environmentally sensitive and flood-prone land from designation as vacant or available for purposes of affordable housing construction.
Imposes penalties on driver who willfully disables and floods motor vehicle during storm-related flooding.
Provides exemption from DEP permit fees to municipalities after natural disaster involving flooding.
Requires green building standards and impact studies for carbon, traffic, storm water, and schools for certain affordable housing development.
Requires DOH to establish Regional Hospital System Program for Emergency Preparedness and to annually survey preparedness and resiliency of State's hospital system in event of public emergency.

"Climate Superfund Act"; imposes liability on certain fossil fuel companies for certain damages caused by climate change and establishes program in DEP to collect and distribute compensatory payments.
Permits certain local units and authorities to reduce water, sewer, and stormwater fees and other charges for low-income persons.*
"Flood Zone Clarification Act"; modifies procedure for delineation of State flood hazard areas.
Amends list of hazard mitigation and resilience projects approved for funding by NJ Infrastructure Bank under FY2025 Community Hazard Assistance Mitigation Program.
Requires DOT to establish five-year highway litter mitigation pilot program and flood mitigation pilot program in certain cities; appropriates $1 million.
Directs DEP to develop and implement water quality, flood control, and stream restoration pilot program.
Establishes Municipal Flood Management Assistance Program in DEP.
Requires DEP and New Jersey Infrastructure Bank to provide priority for principal forgiveness on environmental infrastructure project loans to municipalities in coastal areas.
Eliminates five percent down payment requirement for local bond ordinances involving hazard mitigation and resilience projects.
Requires DEP to establish online flood, rainfall, river level, and sewer capacity dashboard.
Establishes "Smart Stormwater Sensor Pilot Program" in DEP; appropriates $1 million.
Requires State Office of Emergency Management to establish hyperlocal text alert system for flood and severe weather conditions.
Requires DEP to establish program to map stormwater infrastructure.
Requires developer to submit stormwater impact study as part of application for planned development site plan approval.
Requires DCA to resume Reconstruction, Rehabilitation, Elevation, and Mitigation program with remaining funds for unmet recovery and rebuilding needs for Superstorm Sandy-impacted homeowners.
Establishes the "South Jersey Community Resilience Center"; appropriates $500,000.
Directs DEP to establish artificial intelligence flood prediction and mapping tool.
Requires DCA to resume Reconstruction, Rehabilitation, Elevation and Mitigation program with remaining funds for unmet recovery and rebuilding needs for Superstorm Sandy-impacted homeowners.
Urges parties to 1954 U.S. Supreme Court Decree to address ongoing risk of Delaware River Basin flooding.
Urges Congress and the President of the United States to increase subsidies for federal flood insurance.
Determines that DEP rules and regulations known as " New Jersey Protecting Against Climate Change - Resilient Environment and Landscapes" are inconsistent with legislative intent.
Condemns President Trump's decision to withdraw U.S. from Paris Climate Accord.
Constitutes special committee of General Assembly entitled "Assembly Select Committee on New Jersey Transit and the Bound Brook Flood."
Urges lending institutions in State to stop financing projects that contribute to climate change.
Permits certain local units and authorities to reduce water, sewer, and stormwater fees and other charges for low-income persons.*
Establishes "Resiliency and Environmental System Investment Charge Program."
"Flood Control, Mitigation, and Prevention Bond Act"; authorizes bonds for up to $2 billion and appropriates $5,000.
Establishes home elevation fund and dedicates up to $5 million of realty transfer fee revenue annually for this purpose.
Appropriates $5 million to Cranford Township for flood control projects.
Requires electric public utility to reimburse customer for cost of spoiled food and prescription medicine resulting from service outage more than 48 hours after end of storm.
Requires DOT to prioritize green stormwater infrastructure in design, construction, reconstruction, and repair of public highways.
Requires DEP to evaluate cumulative impact of stormwater when reviewing applications associated with warehouse and other high-density development projects.
Revises certain eligibility requirements under NJ Aspire Program; establishes net neutral benefits test for redevelopment projects that incur certain sustainability and resiliency costs.
Revises permitting thresholds for certain types of development requiring CAFRA permit from DEP.
Adds to property tax levy cap exclusions increases in flood insurance premiums.

Requires DEP to prioritize funding for certain projects for acquisition of lands for recreation and conservation purposes and certain environmental infrastructure projects that include, or allow for, flood mitigation projects.
Establishes Small Business Resiliency Project Loan Program in EDA for certain small businesses implementing certain resiliency projects.

Authorizes municipal challenge to non-redevelopment housing projects ordered by COAH unless order is based on exclusionary zoning; excludes flood-prone land from affordable housing vacant land analysis; provides housing obligation cap.

Requires DEP and owners of certain reservoirs to implement certain flood control measures; authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoirs levels in response to severe weather events.
Establishes "Purple Ribbon Schools Program" in DOE to recognize public and nonpublic schools with positive school climate.
Establishes Office of Resilience in DCF.

Reduces allowed diversion of funds from stormwater, water, and sewer purposes to municipal and county budgets; requires municipalities and counties to notify Division of Local Government Services of diversions.
Makes $100 million in federal funds available to DEP for grants to local governments for drinking water, wastewater, and stormwater infrastructure projects.
Excludes environmentally sensitive and flood-prone land from designation as vacant or available for purposes of affordable housing construction.
Provides exemption from DEP permit fees to municipalities after natural disaster involving flooding.
Requires green building standards and impact studies for carbon, traffic, storm water, and schools for certain affordable housing development.
Establishes process to exempt municipality from certain fair share affordable housing obligations based on flood risk.
Permits municipalities to adopt more stringent site improvement standards for storm water management related to residential developments.

"Polluters Pay to Make New Jersey More Affordable Act"; imposes liability on certain fossil fuel companies for funds needed for climate change adaptation projects; establishes program in DEP to collect and distribute funds.*
Amends list of hazard mitigation and resilience projects approved for funding by NJ Infrastructure Bank under FY2025 Community Hazard Assistance Mitigation Program.
"Flood Zone Clarification Act"; modifies procedure for delineation of State flood hazard areas.
Requires DEP and New Jersey Infrastructure Bank to provide priority for principal forgiveness on environmental infrastructure project loans to municipalities in coastal areas.
"Climate Corporate Data Accountability Act"; requires certain business entities to publicize annual greenhouse gas emissions data.
"Flood Zone Clarification Act"; modifies procedure for delineation of State flood hazard areas.
Eliminates five percent down payment requirement for local bond ordinances involving hazard mitigation and resilience projects.
Creates Joint Blue Ribbon Task Force on Impacts of Climate Change on Property Insurance.
Requires four-year public institutions of higher education to require undergraduate students to complete course on climate change.
Requires DCA to resume Reconstruction, Rehabilitation, Elevation and Mitigation program with remaining funds for unmet recovery and rebuilding needs for Superstorm Sandy-impacted homeowners.
Urges President and Congress to enact legislation forgiving community disaster loans issued after Superstorm Sandy.
Urges Congress to investigate claims that insurance companies have used revised engineering reports to deny flood claims from Superstorm Sandy.
Urges U.S. Department of Justice to investigate certain claims handling practices related to Superstorm Sandy flood insurance claims.
Urges Congress and the President of the United States to increase subsidies for federal flood insurance.
Determines that DEP rules and regulations known as " New Jersey Protecting Against Climate Change - Resilient Environment and Landscapes" are inconsistent with legislative intent.
Condemns President Trump's decision to withdraw U.S. from Paris Climate Accord.
Urges lending institutions in State to stop financing projects that contribute to climate change.
